content.description: Huntington’s disease has been traced to the number of <math alttext="C A G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CAG</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> repeats in the <math alttext="H T T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene, which is located on chromosome 4. The phenotypic influence of individual alleles with different numbers of repeats is shown in Table 1.
content.question: Table 1: Effect of <math alttext="C A G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CAG</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> repeat number on Huntington’s disease expression <math alttext="C A G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CAG</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Repeats Expression <math alttext="less than 27" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo><</mo><mn>27</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> No symptoms 27–35 No symptoms but increased risk for offspring 36–39 May develop symptoms in old age <math alttext="greater than 40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>></mo><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Will express symptoms from an early age Which of the following is most likely the immediate cause of the first appearance of Huntington’s disease in a person?

choices.label: A point mutation occurs in the <math alttext="H T T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene.

The first appearance of the <math alttext="C A G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CAG</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> repeat occurs in the <math alttext="H T T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene.
An allele with more than 39 <math alttext="C A G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CAG</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> repeats was inherited by the affected person.
The person inherited two alleles that each contained 20 <math alttext="C A G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CAG</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> repeats.

content.answer: An allele with more than 39 <math alttext="C A G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CAG</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> repeats was inherited by the affected person.
